result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarvis Lamont Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Jarvis Lamont Johnson.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on Defendant's Motion to Suppress. Motion hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Steven Campbell (MPD Officer). Exhibit 1 received. State and Defense rest.  Closing arguments heard. Court's findings set forth in the record. Court DENIES motion. Exhibit 1 withdrawn.  Defense requests plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 40. This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.1.22
Received and Filed: State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress

Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests a motion hearing.  Court set the matter as requested.  Court ordered State's response to be filed by July 17, 2022.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.9.22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 5.13.22

Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a motion hearing date.  Court set a status on the motion.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.6.22

Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 03-09-2022

Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2.3.22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Jarvis Lamont Johnson in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jarvis Lamont Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
